d beat me up, you were bigger than me/nYou

/n
I was sixteen when suddenly/nI
wasnt that little girl you used to see/nBut your
eyes still shined like pretty lights/nAnd our
daddies used to joke about the two of us/nThey

oh my my
my/nTake me

Two A.M. riding in your truck and a
ll I need is you next to me/nTake me

my my my my
/n
A few years had gone and come around/nWe were
sitting at our favorite spot in town/nAnd you
looked at me, got down on one knee/nTake me
back to the time when we walked down the aisle/nOur
whole town came and our mamas cried/nYou
said I do and I did too/nTake me
home where we met so many years before/nWel
l rock our babies on that very front porch/nAfter
all this time, you and I/n
